hu.kazocsaba.math.geometry.fitting

Class LineIntersector

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.kazocsaba.math.geometry.fitting.LineIntersector

  • public class LineIntersector
extends Object
    Algorithm for finding the intersection point of a set of lines. It computes the solution which minimizes the sum of squares of the distances from the lines.
    Author:
    Kaz√≥ Csaba

    • Method Summary

      Finds the point that can be best described as the intersection of a set of lines.

    • Method Detail

      • intersect

        public static Vector intersect(List<? extends Line> lines,
               int dim)
        Finds the point that can be best described as the intersection of a set of lines.
        Parameters:
        lines - the collection of input lines
        dim - the dimensionality of the task (e.g. 3 for 3D lines)
        Returns:
        the intersection point
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the dim is invalid or doesn't match at least one of the lines
        DegenerateCaseException - if no intersection point could be computed

      • intersect2

        public static Vector2 intersect2(List<Line2> lines)
        Finds the point that can be best described as the intersection of a set of 2D lines.
        Parameters:
        lines - the collection of input lines
        Returns:
        the intersection point
        Throws:
        DegenerateCaseException - if no intersection point could be computed

      • intersect3

        public static Vector3 intersect3(List<Line3> lines)
        Finds the point that can be best described as the intersection of a set of 3D lines.
        Parameters:
        lines - the collection of input lines
        Returns:
        the intersection point
        Throws:
        DegenerateCaseException - if no intersection point could be computed
